The Race 
 Mozambican folktale
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day the rabit found a 
 
 snail. 
 
 
 
 He said to the snail, “You 
 
 can't run! Al you know is 
 
 how to crawl on the 
 
 ground.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The snail said, “Come and 
 
 se on Sunday.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The snail prepared a 
 
 hundred pieces of paper 
 
 and wrote the same 
 
 mesage on them. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The snail handed out the 
 
 pieces of paper to his 
 
 friends and said, “When the 
 
 rabit comes here caling 
 
 me, one of you must say: I 
 
 am the snail.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then the snail told his 
 
 friends to hide behind the 
 
 bushes where the rabit 
 
 and the snail were to pas. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 On Sunday, the rabit 
 
 arived and found the snail. 
 
 
 
 The rabit said, “Let´s have 
 
 a race. 
 
 But I wil win.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Snails lined up behind tres 
 
 on the racing track so that 
 
 each time the rabit 
 
 pased, a snail would 
 
 shout, ‘I am the snail…’ 
 
 
 
 During the race, the rabit 
 
 caled out, “Snail! Snail!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One of the snails hiden 
 
 behind the bushes 
 
 answered, “I am the snail! I 
 
 am the snail!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Finaly, the rabit was very 
 
 tired. 
 
 
 
 He lay down, saying, “Snail, 
 
 I am so tired; you have 
 
 won.” 
 
 
 
 One snail watched from 
 
 
 behind the bush. 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So the snail won the race 
 
 because he was clever!
